Enum.name: UCSWRST_0
Enum.description: Disabled. eUSCI_A reset released for operation

Enum.name: UCSWRST_1
Enum.description: Enabled. eUSCI_A logic held in reset state

Enum.name: UCTXBRK_0
Enum.description: Next frame transmitted is not a break

Enum.name: UCTXBRK_1
Enum.description: Next frame transmitted is a break or a break/synch

Enum.name: UCTXADDR_1
Enum.description: Next frame transmitted is an address

Enum.name: UCDORM_0
Enum.description: Not dormant. All received characters set UCRXIFG.

Enum.name: UCDORM_1
Enum.description: Dormant. Only characters that are preceded by an idle-line or with address bit set UCRXIFG. In UART mode with automatic baud-rate detection, only the combination of a break and synch field sets UCRXIFG.

Enum.name: UCBRKIE_0
Enum.description: Received break characters do not set UCRXIFG

Enum.name: UCRXEIE_0
Enum.description: Erroneous characters rejected and UCRXIFG is not set

Enum.name: UCMODE_3
Enum.description: UART mode with automatic baud-rate detection

Enum.name: UCPEN_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled. Parity bit is generated (UCAxTXD) and expected (UCAxRXD). In address-bit multiprocessor mode, the address bit is included in the parity calculation.

Register.name: UCAxBRW
Register.description: eUSCI_Ax Baud Rate Control Word Register

BitField.name: UCBR
BitField.description: Clock prescaler setting of the Baud rate generator

BitField.name: UCPE
BitField.description: Parity error flag. When UCPEN = 0, UCPE is read as 0. UCPE is cleared when UCAxRXBUF is read.

Enum.name: UCFE_1
Enum.description: Character received with low stop bit

Enum.name: UCLISTEN_1
Enum.description: Enabled. UCAxTXD is internally fed back to the receiver

Register.name: UCAxABCTL
Register.description: eUSCI_Ax Auto Baud Rate Control Register

Enum.name: UCABDEN_0
Enum.description: Baud-rate detection disabled. Length of break and synch field is not measured.

Enum.name: UCABDEN_1
Enum.description: Baud-rate detection enabled. Length of break and synch field is measured and baud-rate settings are changed accordingly.

Enum.name: UCBTOE_1
Enum.description: Length of break field exceeded 22 bit times

Enum.name: UCSTOE_1
Enum.description: Length of synch field exceeded measurable time

Enum.name: UCIRRXPL_0
Enum.description: IrDA transceiver delivers a high pulse when a light pulse is seen

Enum.name: UCIRRXPL_1
Enum.description: IrDA transceiver delivers a low pulse when a light pulse is seen

Enum.name: UCIV_2
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Receive buffer full; Interrupt Flag: UCRXIFG; Interrupt Priority: Highest

Enum.name: UCIV_4
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Transmit buffer empty; Interrupt Flag: UCTXIFG

Enum.name: UCIV_6
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Start bit received; Interrupt Flag: UCSTTIFG

Enum.name: UCIV_8
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Transmit complete; Interrupt Flag: UCTXCPTIFG; Interrupt Priority: Lowest

BitField.name: UCTXSTT
BitField.description: Transmit START condition in master mode

BitField.name: UCTXSTP
BitField.description: Transmit STOP condition in master mode

BitField.name: UCTXACK
BitField.description: Transmit ACK condition in slave mode

Enum.name: UCTXACK_0
Enum.description: Do not acknowledge the slave address

Enum.name: UCMODE_1
Enum.description: 4-pin SPI (master or slave enabled if STE = 1)

Enum.name: UCMODE_2
Enum.description: 4-pin SPI (master or slave enabled if STE = 0)

Enum.name: UCMM_0
Enum.description: Single master environment. There is no other master in the system. The address compare unit is disabled.

Enum.name: UCASTP_0
Enum.description: No automatic STOP generation. The STOP condition is generated after the user sets the UCTXSTP bit. The value in UCBxTBCNT is a don't care.

Enum.name: UCASTP_1
Enum.description: UCBCNTIFG is set with the byte counter reaches the threshold defined in UCBxTBCNT

Enum.name: UCASTP_2
Enum.description: A STOP condition is generated automatically after the byte counter value reached UCBxTBCNT. UCBCNTIFG is set with the byte counter reaching the threshold

Enum.name: UCSWACK_0
Enum.description: The address acknowledge of the slave is controlled by the eUSCI_B module

Enum.name: UCSWACK_1
Enum.description: The user needs to trigger the sending of the address ACK by issuing UCTXACK

Enum.name: UCSTPNACK_0
Enum.description: Send a non-acknowledge before the STOP condition as a master receiver (conform to I2C standard)

Enum.name: UCSTPNACK_1
Enum.description: All bytes are acknowledged by the eUSCI_B when configured as master receiver

Enum.name: UCETXINT_0
Enum.description: UCTXIFGx is set after an address match with UCxI2COAx and the direction bit indicating slave transmit

Enum.name: UCETXINT_1
Enum.description: UCTXIFG0 is set for each START condition

Register.name: UCBxBRW
Register.description: eUSCI_Bx Baud Rate Control Word Register

Enum.name: UCOAEN_0
Enum.description: The slave address defined in I2COA0 is disabled

Enum.name: UCOAEN_1
Enum.description: The slave address defined in I2COA0 is enabled

Enum.name: UCGCEN_0
Enum.description: Do not respond to a general call

Enum.name: UCOAEN_0
Enum.description: The slave address defined in I2COA1 is disabled

Enum.name: UCOAEN_1
Enum.description: The slave address defined in I2COA1 is enabled

Enum.name: UCOAEN_0
Enum.description: The slave address defined in I2COA2 is disabled

Enum.name: UCOAEN_1
Enum.description: The slave address defined in I2COA2 is enabled

Enum.name: UCOAEN_0
Enum.description: The slave address defined in I2COA3 is disabled

Enum.name: UCOAEN_1
Enum.description: The slave address defined in I2COA3 is enabled

BitField.name: ADDMASK
BitField.description: Address Mask Register. By clearing the corresponding bit of the own address, this bit is a don't care when comparing the address on the bus to the own address. Using this method, it is possible to react on more than one slave address. When all bits of ADDMASKx are set, the address mask feature is deactivated. Modify only when UCSWRST = 1.

Enum.name: UCIV_2
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Arbitration lost; Interrupt Flag: UCALIFG; Interrupt Priority: Highest

Enum.name: UCIV_4
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Not acknowledgment; Interrupt Flag: UCNACKIFG

Enum.name: UCIV_6
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Start condition received; Interrupt Flag: UCSTTIFG

Enum.name: UCIV_8
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Stop condition received; Interrupt Flag: UCSTPIFG

Enum.name: UCIV_10
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Slave 3 Data received; Interrupt Flag: UCRXIFG3

Enum.name: UCIV_12
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Slave 3 Transmit buffer empty; Interrupt Flag: UCTXIFG3

Enum.name: UCIV_14
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Slave 2 Data received; Interrupt Flag: UCRXIFG2

Enum.name: UCIV_16
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Slave 2 Transmit buffer empty; Interrupt Flag: UCTXIFG2

Enum.name: UCIV_18
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Slave 1 Data received; Interrupt Flag: UCRXIFG1

Enum.name: UCIV_20
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Slave 1 Transmit buffer empty; Interrupt Flag: UCTXIFG1

Enum.name: UCIV_22
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Data received; Interrupt Flag: UCRXIFG0

Enum.name: UCIV_24
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Transmit buffer empty; Interrupt Flag: UCTXIFG0

Enum.name: UCIV_26
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Byte counter zero; Interrupt Flag: UCBCNTIFG

Enum.name: UCIV_28
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Clock low timeout; Interrupt Flag: UCCLTOIFG

Enum.name: UCIV_30
Enum.description: Interrupt Source: Nineth bit position; Interrupt Flag: UCBIT9IFG; Priority: Lowest

Enum.name: UCSWRST_0
Enum.description: Disabled. eUSCI_B reset released for operation

Enum.name: UCSWRST_1
Enum.description: Enabled. eUSCI_B logic held in reset state

BitField.name: ADDMASK
BitField.description: Address Mask Register. By clearing the corresponding bit of the own address, this bit is a don't care when comparing the address on the bus to the own address. Using this method, it is possible to react on more than one slave address. When all bits of ADDMASKx are set, the address mask feature is deactivated. Modify only when UCSWRST = 1.

BitField.description: Transmit ACK condition in slave mode

Enum.name: UCTXACK_0
Enum.description: Do not acknowledge the slave address

Enum.name: UCMODE_1
Enum.description: 4-pin SPI (master or slave enabled if STE = 1)

Enum.name: UCMODE_2
Enum.description: 4-pin SPI (master or slave enabled if STE = 0)

Enum.name: UCMM_0
Enum.description: Single master environment. There is no other master in the system. The address compare unit is disabled.

Enum.name: UCASTP_0
Enum.description: No automatic STOP generation. The STOP condition is generated after the user sets the UCTXSTP bit. The value in UCBxTBCNT is a don't care.

Enum.name: UCASTP_1
Enum.description: UCBCNTIFG is set with the byte counter reaches the threshold defined in UCBxTBCNT

Enum.name: UCASTP_2
Enum.description: A STOP condition is generated automatically after the byte counter value reached UCBxTBCNT. UCBCNTIFG is set with the byte counter reaching the threshold

Enum.name: UCSWACK_0
Enum.description: The address acknowledge of the slave is controlled by the eUSCI_B module

Enum.name: UCSWACK_1
Enum.description: The user needs to trigger the sending of the address ACK by issuing UCTXACK

Enum.name: UCSTPNACK_0
Enum.description: Send a non-acknowledge before the STOP condition as a master receiver (conform to I2C standard)

Enum.name: UCSTPNACK_1
Enum.description: All bytes are acknowledged by the eUSCI_B when configured as master receiver

Enum.name: UCETXINT_0
Enum.description: UCTXIFGx is set after an address match with UCxI2COAx and the direction bit indicating slave transmit

Enum.name: UCETXINT_1
Enum.description: UCTXIFG0 is set for each START condition

BitField.name: STATE
BitField.description: Current state of the control state machine. State can be one of the following:

Enum.name: STATE_6
Enum.description: waiting for DMA request to clear

BitField.name: DMACHANS
BitField.description: Number of available DMA channels minus one.

Enum.name: DMACHANS_0
Enum.description: Controller configured to use 1 DMA channel

Enum.name: DMACHANS_1
Enum.description: Controller configured to use 2 DMA channels

Enum.name: DMACHANS_30
Enum.description: Controller configured to use 31 DMA channels

Enum.name: DMACHANS_31
Enum.description: Controller configured to use 32 DMA channels

BitField.name: TESTSTAT
BitField.description: To reduce the gate count the controller can be configured to exclude the integration test logic. The values 2h to Fh are Reserved.

Enum.name: TESTSTAT_0
Enum.description: Controller does not include the integration test logic

Enum.name: TESTSTAT_1
Enum.description: Controller includes the integration test logic

BitField.name: CHPROTCTRL
BitField.description: Sets the AHB-Lite protection by controlling the HPROT[3:1] signal levels as follows: Bit [7] Controls HPROT[3] to indicate if a cacheable access is occurring. Bit [6] Controls HPROT[2] to indicate if a bufferable access is occurring. Bit [5] Controls HPROT[1] to indicate if a privileged access is occurring. Note: When bit [n] = 1 then the corresponding HPROT is HIGH. When bit [n] = 0 then the corresponding HPROT is LOW.

Register.name: DMA_CTLBASE
Register.description: Channel Control Data Base Pointer Register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Pointer to the base address of the primary data structure.

Register.name: DMA_ALTBASE
Register.description: Channel Alternate Control Data Base Pointer Register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Base address of the alternate data structure

Register.name: DMA_WAITSTAT
Register.description: Channel Wait on Request Status Register

BitField.name: CHNL_SW_REQ
BitField.description: Set the appropriate bit to generate a software DMA request on the corresponding DMA channel. Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented does not create a DMA request for that channel.

Enum.name: CHNL_SW_REQ_0
Enum.description: Does not create a DMA request for the channel

Enum.name: CHNL_SW_REQ_1
Enum.description: Creates a DMA request for the channel

BitField.name: SET
BitField.description: Returns the useburst status, or disables dma_sreq from generating DMA requests.

Enum.name: SET_0_READ
Enum.description: DMA channel C responds to requests that it receives on dma_req[C] or dma_sreq[C]. The controller performs 2R, or single, bus transfers.

Enum.name: SET_1_READ
Enum.description: DMA channel C does not respond to requests that it receives on dma_sreq[C]. The controller only responds to dma_req[C] requests and performs 2R transfers.

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Set the appropriate bit to enable dma_sreq to generate requests.

Enum.name: CLR_0
Enum.description: No effect. Use the DMA_USEBURST_SET Register to disable dma_sreq from generating requests.

Enum.name: CLR_1
Enum.description: Enables dma_sreq[C] to generate DMA requests. Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect.

BitField.name: SET
BitField.description: Returns the request mask status of dma_req and dma_sreq, or disables the corresponding channel from generating DMA requests.

Enum.name: SET_0_READ
Enum.description: External requests are enabled for channel C.

Enum.name: SET_1_READ
Enum.description: External requests are disabled for channel C.

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Set the appropriate bit to enable DMA requests for the channel corresponding to dma_req and dma_sreq.

Enum.name: CLR_0
Enum.description: No effect. Use the DMA_REQMASKSET Register to disable dma_req and dma_sreq from generating requests.

Enum.name: CLR_1
Enum.description: Enables dma_req[C] or dma_sreq[C] to generate DMA requests. Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect.

BitField.name: SET
BitField.description: Returns the enable status of the channels, or enables the corresponding channels.

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Set the appropriate bit to disable the corresponding DMA channel. Note: The controller disables a channel, by setting the appropriate bit, when: a) it completes the DMA cycle b) it reads a channel_cfg memory location which has cycle_ctrl = b000 c) an ERROR occurs on the AHB-Lite bus.

Enum.name: CLR_0
Enum.description: No effect. Use the DMA_ENASET Register to enable DMA channels.

Enum.name: CLR_1
Enum.description: Disables channel C. Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect.

Enum.name: SET_0_READ
Enum.description: DMA channel C is using the primary data structure.

Enum.name: SET_1_READ
Enum.description: DMA channel C is using the alternate data structure.

Enum.name: CLR_0
Enum.description: No effect. Use the DMA_ALTSET Register to select the alternate data structure.

Enum.name: CLR_1
Enum.description: Selects the primary data structure for channel C. Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect.

BitField.name: SET
BitField.description: Returns the channel priority mask status, or sets the channel priority to high.

Enum.name: SET_0_READ
Enum.description: DMA channel C is using the default priority level.

Enum.name: SET_1_READ
Enum.description: DMA channel C is using a high priority level.

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Set the appropriate bit to select the default priority level for the specified DMA channel.

Enum.name: CLR_0
Enum.description: No effect. Use the DMA_PRIOSET Register to set channel C to the high priority level.

Enum.name: CLR_1
Enum.description: Channel C uses the default priority level. Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect.

BitField.name: ERRCLR
BitField.description:
Returns the status of dma_err, or sets the signal LOW.
For test purposes, use the ERRSET register to set dma_err HIGH. Note: If you deassert dma_err at the same time as an ERROR occurs on the AHB-Lite bus, then the ERROR condition takes precedence and dma_err remains asserted.

Enum.name: AMR_0
Enum.description: LDO based Active Mode at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: AMR_1
Enum.description: LDO based Active Mode at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: AMR_4
Enum.description: DC-DC based Active Mode at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: AMR_5
Enum.description: DC-DC based Active Mode at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: AMR_8
Enum.description: Low-Frequency Active Mode at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: AMR_9
Enum.description: Low-Frequency Active Mode at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: LPMR_0
Enum.description: LPM3. Core voltage setting is similar to the mode from which LPM3 is entered.

Enum.name: CPM_0
Enum.description: LDO based Active Mode at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: CPM_1
Enum.description: LDO based Active Mode at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: CPM_4
Enum.description: DC-DC based Active Mode at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: CPM_5
Enum.description: DC-DC based Active Mode at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: CPM_8
Enum.description: Low-Frequency Active Mode at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: CPM_9
Enum.description: Low-Frequency Active Mode at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: CPM_16
Enum.description: LDO based LPM0 at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: CPM_17
Enum.description: LDO based LPM0 at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: CPM_20
Enum.description: DC-DC based LPM0 at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: CPM_21
Enum.description: DC-DC based LPM0 at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: CPM_24
Enum.description: Low-Frequency LPM0 at Core voltage setting 0.

Enum.name: CPM_25
Enum.description: Low-Frequency LPM0 at Core voltage setting 1.

Enum.name: LOCKLPM5_0
Enum.description: LPMx.5 configuration defaults to reset condition

Enum.name: LOCKLPM5_1
Enum.description: LPMx.5 configuration remains locked during LPMx.5 entry and exit

Enum.name: LOCKBKUP_0
Enum.description: Backup domain configuration defaults to reset condition

Enum.name: LOCKBKUP_1
Enum.description: Backup domain configuration remains locked during LPM3.5 entry and exit

Enum.name: FORCE_LPM_ENTRY_0
Enum.description: PCM aborts LPM3/LPMx.5 transition if the active clock configuration does not meet the LPM3/LPMx.5 entry criteria. PCM generates the LPM_INVALID_CLK flag on abort to LPM3/LPMx.5 entry.

Enum.name: FORCE_LPM_ENTRY_1
Enum.description: PCM enters LPM3/LPMx.5 after shuting off the clocks forcefully. Application needs to ensure RTC and WDT are clocked using BCLK tree to keep these modules alive in LPM3/LPM3.5. In LPM4.5 all clocks are forcefully shutoff and the core voltage is turned off.

BitField.name: AM_INVALID_TR_IE
BitField.description: Active mode invalid transition interrupt enable

BitField.name: CLR_AM_INVALID_TR_IFG
BitField.description: Clear active mode invalid transition flag

BitField.name: DCORES
BitField.description: Enables the DCO external resistor mode

Enum.name: DCOEN_0
Enum.description: DCO is on if it is used as a source for MCLK, HSMCLK , or SMCLK and clock is requested, otherwise it is disabled.

Enum.name: SELM_7
Enum.description: for future use. Defaults to DCOCLK. Not recommended for use to ensure future compatibilities.

BitField.name: SELS
BitField.description: Selects the SMCLK and HSMCLK source

Enum.name: SELS_7
Enum.description: for furture use. Defaults to DCOCLK. Do not use to ensure future compatibilities.

Enum.name: SELA_3
Enum.description: for future use. Defaults to REFOCLK. Not recommended for use to ensure future compatibilities.

Enum.name: SELA_4
Enum.description: for future use. Defaults to REFOCLK. Not recommended for use to ensure future compatibilities.

Enum.name: SELA_5
Enum.description: for future use. Defaults to REFOCLK. Not recommended for use to ensure future compatibilities.

Enum.name: SELA_6
Enum.description: for future use. Defaults to REFOCLK. Not recommended for use to ensure future compatibilities.

Enum.name: SELA_7
Enum.description: for future use. Defaults to REFOCLK. Not recommended for use to ensure future compatibilities.

BitField.name: LFXTDRIVE
BitField.description: LFXT oscillator current can be adjusted to its drive needs

Enum.name: LFXTDRIVE_0
Enum.description: Lowest drive strength and current consumption LFXT oscillator.

Enum.name: LFXTDRIVE_3
Enum.description: Maximum drive strength and maximum current consumption LFXT oscillator.

BitField.name: LFXTAGCOFF
BitField.description: Disables the automatic gain control of the LFXT crystal

BitField.name: LFXT_EN
BitField.description: Turns on the LFXT oscillator regardless if used as a clock resource

Enum.name: LFXT_EN_0
Enum.description: LFXT is on if it is used as a source for ACLK, MCLK, HSMCLK , or SMCLK and is selected via the port selection and not in bypass mode of operation.

Enum.name: LFXT_EN_1
Enum.description: LFXT is on if LFXT is selected via the port selection and LFXT is not in bypass mode of operation.

Enum.name: LFXTBYPASS_1
Enum.description: LFXT sourced by external square wave.

Enum.name: HFXTDRIVE_0
Enum.description: To be used for HFXTFREQ setting 000b

Enum.name: HFXTDRIVE_1
Enum.description: To be used for HFXTFREQ settings 001b to 110b

BitField.name: HFXT_EN
BitField.description: Turns on the HFXT oscillator regardless if used as a clock resource

Enum.name: HFXT_EN_0
Enum.description: HFXT is on if it is used as a source for MCLK, HSMCLK , or SMCLK and is selected via the port selection and not in bypass mode of operation.

Enum.name: HFXT_EN_1
Enum.description: HFXT is on if HFXT is selected via the port selection and HFXT is not in bypass mode of operation.

Enum.name: HFXTBYPASS_1
Enum.description: HFXT sourced by external square wave.

BitField.name: RFCNTLF
BitField.description: Reset start fault counter for LFXT

Enum.name: RFCNTLF_0
Enum.description: Not applicable. Always reads as zero due to self clearing.

BitField.name: FCNTLF_EN
BitField.description: Enable start fault counter for LFXT

Enum.name: FCNTLF_EN_0
Enum.description: Startup fault counter disabled. Counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RFCNTHF
BitField.description: Reset start fault counter for HFXT

Enum.name: RFCNTHF_0
Enum.description: Not applicable. Always reads as zero due to self clearing.

BitField.name: FCNTHF_EN
BitField.description: Enable start fault counter for HFXT

Enum.name: FCNTHF_EN_0
Enum.description: Startup fault counter disabled. Counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RFCNTHF2
BitField.description: Reset start fault counter for HFXT2

Enum.name: RFCNTHF2_0
Enum.description: Not applicable. Always reads as zero due to self clearing.

BitField.name: FCNTHF2_EN
BitField.description: Enable start fault counter for HFXT2

Enum.name: FCNTHF2_EN_0
Enum.description: Startup fault counter disabled. Counter is cleared.

BitField.name: ACLK_EN
BitField.description: ACLK system clock conditional request enable

Enum.name: ACLK_EN_0
Enum.description: ACLK disabled regardless of conditional clock requests

Enum.name: ACLK_EN_1
Enum.description: ACLK enabled based on any conditional clock requests

BitField.name: MCLK_EN
BitField.description: MCLK system clock conditional request enable

Enum.name: MCLK_EN_0
Enum.description: MCLK disabled regardless of conditional clock requests

Enum.name: MCLK_EN_1
Enum.description: MCLK enabled based on any conditional clock requests

BitField.name: HSMCLK_EN
BitField.description: HSMCLK system clock conditional request enable

Enum.name: HSMCLK_EN_0
Enum.description: HSMCLK disabled regardless of conditional clock requests

Enum.name: HSMCLK_EN_1
Enum.description: HSMCLK enabled based on any conditional clock requests

BitField.name: SMCLK_EN
BitField.description: SMCLK system clock conditional request enable

Enum.name: SMCLK_EN_0
Enum.description: SMCLK disabled regardless of conditional clock requests.

Enum.name: SMCLK_EN_1
Enum.description: SMCLK enabled based on any conditional clock requests

Enum.name: VLO_EN_0
Enum.description: VLO is on only if it is used as a source for ACLK, MCLK, HSMCLK or SMCLK.

Enum.name: REFO_EN_0
Enum.description: REFO is on only if it is used as a source for ACLK, MCLK, HSMCLK or SMCLK

Enum.name: MODOSC_EN_0
Enum.description: MODOSC is on only if it is used as a source for ACLK, MCLK, HSMCLK or SMCLK

BitField.name: HFXTIE

BitField.name: HFXT2IE
BitField.description: HFXT2 oscillator fault flag interrupt enable

BitField.name: DCOR_OPNIE
BitField.description: DCO external resistor open circuit fault flag interrupt enable.

BitField.name: FCNTHFIE
BitField.description: Start fault counter interrupt enable HFXT

BitField.name: FCNTHF2IE
BitField.description: Start fault counter interrupt enable HFXT2

Enum.name: LFXTIFG_0
Enum.description: No fault condition occurred after the last reset

Enum.name: LFXTIFG_1
Enum.description: LFXT fault. A LFXT fault occurred after the last reset

Enum.name: HFXTIFG_0
Enum.description: No fault condition occurred after the last reset

Enum.name: HFXTIFG_1
Enum.description: HFXT fault. A HFXT fault occurred after the last reset

Enum.name: HFXT2IFG_0
Enum.description: No fault condition occurred after the last reset

Enum.name: HFXT2IFG_1
Enum.description: HFXT2 fault. A HFXT2 fault occurred after the last reset

BitField.name: DCOR_SHTIFG
BitField.description: DCO external resistor short circuit fault flag.

Enum.name: DCOR_SHTIFG_1
Enum.description: DCO external resistor short circuit fault

BitField.name: DCOR_OPNIFG
BitField.description: DCO external resistor open circuit fault flag.

Enum.name: DCOR_OPNIFG_1
Enum.description: DCO external resistor open circuit fault

BitField.name: FCNTHFIFG

BitField.name: FCNTHF2IFG
BitField.description: Start fault counter interrupt flag HFXT2

BitField.name: CLR_HFXTIFG
BitField.description: Clear HFXT oscillator fault interrupt flag

BitField.name: CLR_HFXT2IFG
BitField.description: Clear HFXT2 oscillator fault interrupt flag

BitField.name: CLR_DCOR_OPNIFG
BitField.description: Clear DCO external resistor open circuit fault interrupt flag.

BitField.name: CLR_CALIFG
BitField.description: REFCNT period counter clear interrupt flag

BitField.name: CLR_FCNTLFIFG
BitField.description: Start fault counter clear interrupt flag LFXT

BitField.name: CLR_FCNTHFIFG
BitField.description: Start fault counter clear interrupt flag HFXT

BitField.name: CLR_FCNTHF2IFG
BitField.description: Start fault counter clear interrupt flag HFXT2

BitField.name: SET_LFXTIFG
BitField.description: Set LFXT oscillator fault interrupt flag

BitField.name: SET_HFXTIFG
BitField.description: Set HFXT oscillator fault interrupt flag

BitField.name: SET_HFXT2IFG
BitField.description: Set HFXT2 oscillator fault interrupt flag

BitField.name: SET_DCOR_OPNIFG
BitField.description: Set DCO external resistor open circuit fault interrupt flag.

BitField.name: SET_CALIFG
BitField.description: REFCNT period counter set interrupt flag

BitField.name: SET_FCNTHFIFG

BitField.name: SET_FCNTHF2IFG
BitField.description: Start fault counter set interrupt flag HFXT2

BitField.name: SET_FCNTLFIFG
BitField.description: Start fault counter set interrupt flag LFXT

BitField.name: DCO_FCAL_RSEL04
BitField.description: DCO frequency calibration for DCO frequency range (DCORSEL) 0 to 4.

BitField.name: DCO_FCAL_RSEL5
BitField.description: DCO frequency calibration for DCO frequency range (DCORSEL) 5.

BitField.name: SVSMHLP
BitField.description: SVSM high-side low power normal performance mode

Enum.name: SVSMHLP_0
Enum.description: Full performance mode. See the device-specific data sheet for response times.

Enum.name: SVSMHLP_1
Enum.description: Low power normal performance mode in LPM3, LPM4, and LPMx.5, full performance in all other modes. See the device-specific data sheet for response times.

BitField.name: SVSMHS
BitField.description: Supply supervisor or monitor selection for the high-side

Enum.name: SVMHOE_1
Enum.description: SVSMHIFG bit is output to the device SVMHOUT pin. The device-specific port logic must be configured accordingly

Enum.name: SVMHOUTPOLAL_0
Enum.description: SVMHOUT is active high. An error condition is signaled by a 1 at the SVMHOUT pin

Enum.name: SVMHOUTPOLAL_1
Enum.description: SVMHOUT is active low. An error condition is signaled by a 0 at the SVMHOUT pin

Enum.name: DCDC_FORCE_0
Enum.description: DC-DC regulator operation not forced. Automatic fail-safe mechanism switches the core voltage regulator from DC-DC to LDO when the supply voltage falls below the minimum supply voltage necessary for DC-DC operation.

Enum.name: DCDC_FORCE_1
Enum.description: DC-DC regulator operation forced. Automatic fail-safe mechanism is disabled and device continues to operate out of DC-DC regulator.

BitField.name: VCORETRAN
BitField.description: Controls core voltage level transition time

Enum.name: PSTAT_1
Enum.description: Flash IP Vdd domain power-up in progress

Enum.name: PSTAT_2
Enum.description: PSS LDO_GOOD, IREF_OK and VREF_OK check in progress

Enum.name: PSTAT_3
Enum.description: Flash IP SAFE_LV check in progress

Enum.name: PSTAT_5
Enum.description: Flash IP Active in Low-Frequency Active and Low-Frequency LPM0 modes.

Enum.name: PSTAT_7
Enum.description: Flash IP in Current mirror boost state

BitField.name: RD_2T
BitField.description: Indicates if Flash is being accessed in 2T mode

BitField.name: RD_MODE
BitField.description: Flash read mode control setting for Bank 0

BitField.name: BUFI
BitField.description: Enables read buffering feature for instruction fetches to this Bank

BitField.name: BUFD
BitField.description: Enables read buffering feature for data reads to this Bank

BitField.name: WAIT
BitField.description: Number of wait states for read

BitField.name: RD_MODE
BitField.description: Flash read mode control setting for Bank 0

BitField.name: BUFI
BitField.description: Enables read buffering feature for instruction fetches to this Bank

BitField.name: BUFD
BitField.description: Enables read buffering feature for data reads to this Bank

BitField.name: WAIT
BitField.description: Number of wait states for read

Register.name: FLCTL_RDBRST_CTLSTAT
Register.description: Read Burst/Compare Control and Status Register

BitField.name: MEM_TYPE
BitField.description: Type of memory that burst is carried out on

BitField.name: DATA_CMP
BitField.description: Data pattern used for comparison against memory read data

BitField.name: TEST_EN
BitField.description: Enable comparison against test data compare registers

Enum.name: BRST_STAT_1
Enum.description: Burst/Compare START bit written, but operation pending

Enum.name: BRST_STAT_3
Enum.description: Burst complete (status of completed burst remains in this state unless explicitly cleared by SW)

BitField.name: CMP_ERR
BitField.description: Burst/Compare Operation encountered atleast one data

BitField.name: ADDR_ERR
BitField.description: Burst/Compare Operation was terminated due to access to

BitField.name: CLR_STAT
BitField.description: Clear status bits 19-16 of this register

BitField.name: FAIL_ADDRESS
BitField.description: Reflects address of last failed compare

BitField.name: FAIL_COUNT
BitField.description: Number of failures encountered in burst operation

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Master control for all word program operations

Enum.name: MODE_0
Enum.description: Write immediate mode. Starts program operation immediately on each write to the Flash

Enum.name: MODE_1
Enum.description: Full word write mode. Flash controller collates data over multiple writes to compose the full 128bit word before initiating the program operation

BitField.name: VER_PRE
BitField.description: Controls automatic pre program verify operations

Enum.name: VER_PRE_1
Enum.description: Pre verify feature automatically invoked for each write operation (irrespective of the mode)

BitField.name: VER_PST
BitField.description: Controls automatic post program verify operations

Enum.name: VER_PST_1
Enum.description: Post verify feature automatically invoked for each write operation (irrespective of the mode)

BitField.name: STATUS
BitField.description: Status of program operations in the Flash memory

Enum.name: STATUS_1
Enum.description: Single word program operation triggered, but pending

Register.name: FLCTL_PRGBRST_CTLSTAT
Register.description: Program Burst Control and Status Register

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Trigger start of burst program operation

BitField.name: TYPE
BitField.description: Type of memory that burst program is carried out on

Enum.name: LEN_1
Enum.description: 1 word burst of 128 bits, starting with address in the FLCTL_PRGBRST_STARTADDR Register

Enum.name: LEN_2
Enum.description: 2*128 bits burst write, starting with address in the FLCTL_PRGBRST_STARTADDR Register

Enum.name: LEN_3
Enum.description: 3*128 bits burst write, starting with address in the FLCTL_PRGBRST_STARTADDR Register

Enum.name: LEN_4
Enum.description: 4*128 bits burst write, starting with address in the FLCTL_PRGBRST_STARTADDR Register

BitField.name: AUTO_PRE
BitField.description: Auto-Verify operation before the Burst Program

Enum.name: AUTO_PRE_0
Enum.description: No program verify operations carried out

Enum.name: AUTO_PRE_1
Enum.description: Causes an automatic Burst Program Verify after the Burst Program Operation

BitField.name: AUTO_PST
BitField.description: Auto-Verify operation after the Burst Program

Enum.name: AUTO_PST_0
Enum.description: No program verify operations carried out

Enum.name: AUTO_PST_1
Enum.description: Causes an automatic Burst Program Verify before the Burst Program Operation

Enum.name: BURST_STATUS_2
Enum.description: Burst active, with 1st 128 bit word being written into Flash

Enum.name: BURST_STATUS_3
Enum.description: Burst active, with 2nd 128 bit word being written into Flash

Enum.name: BURST_STATUS_4
Enum.description: Burst active, with 3rd 128 bit word being written into Flash

Enum.name: BURST_STATUS_5
Enum.description: Burst active, with 4th 128 bit word being written into Flash

Enum.name: BURST_STATUS_7
Enum.description: Burst Complete (status of completed burst remains in this state unless explicitly cleared by SW)

BitField.name: PRE_ERR
BitField.description: Burst Operation encountered preprogram auto-verify errors

BitField.name: PST_ERR
BitField.description: Burst Operation encountered postprogram auto-verify errors

BitField.name: ADDR_ERR
BitField.description: Burst Operation was terminated due to attempted program of reserved memory

BitField.name: CLR_STAT
BitField.description: Clear status bits 21-16 of this register

BitField.name: START_ADDRESS
BitField.description: Start Address of Program Burst Operation

Enum.name: MODE_1
Enum.description: Mass Erase (includes all Main and Information memory sectors that don't have corresponding WE bits set)

BitField.name: TYPE
BitField.description: Type of memory that erase operation is carried out on

BitField.name: STATUS
BitField.description: Status of erase operations in the Flash memory

Enum.name: STATUS_1
Enum.description: Erase operation triggered to START but pending

Enum.name: STATUS_3
Enum.description: Erase operation completed (status of completed erase remains in this state unless explicitly cleared by SW)

BitField.name: ADDR_ERR
BitField.description: Erase Operation was terminated due to attempted erase of reserved memory address

BitField.name: CLR_STAT
BitField.description: Clear status bits 18-16 of this register

BitField.name: I_BMRK
BitField.description: When 1, increments the Instruction Benchmark count register on each instruction fetch to the Flash

BitField.name: D_BMRK
BitField.description: When 1, increments the Data Benchmark count register on each data read access to the Flash

BitField.name: CMP_EN
BitField.description: When 1, enables comparison of the Instruction or Data Benchmark Registers against the threshold value

BitField.name: CMP_SEL
BitField.description: Selects which benchmark register should be compared against the threshold

Enum.name: en_1_0x0
Enum.description: Compares the Instruction Benchmark Register against the threshold value

Enum.name: en_2_0x1
Enum.description: Compares the Data Benchmark Register against the threshold value

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Reflects the number of Instruction Fetches to the Flash (increments by one on each fetch)

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Reflects the number of Data Read operations to the Flash (increments by one on each read)

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Reflects the threshold value that is compared against either the IFETCH or DREAD Benchmark Counters

BitField.name: RDBRST
BitField.description: If set to 1, indicates that the Read Burst/Compare operation is complete

BitField.name: AVPRE
BitField.description: If set to 1, indicates that the pre-program verify operation has detected an error

BitField.name: AVPST
BitField.description: If set to 1, indicates that the post-program verify operation has failed comparison

BitField.name: PRG
BitField.description: If set to 1, indicates that a word Program operation is complete

BitField.name: PRGB
BitField.description: If set to 1, indicates that the configured Burst Program operation is complete

BitField.name: ERASE
BitField.description: If set to 1, indicates that the Erase operation is complete

BitField.name: BMRK
BitField.description: If set to 1, indicates that a Benchmark Compare match occurred

BitField.name: PRG_ERR
BitField.description: If set to 1, indicates a word composition error in full word write mode (possible data loss due to writes crossing over to a new 128bit boundary before full word has been composed)

BitField.name: RDBRST
BitField.description: If set to 1, enables the Controller to generate an interrupt based on the corresponding bit in the FLCTL_IFG

BitField.name: AVPRE
BitField.description: If set to 1, enables the Controller to generate an interrupt based on the corresponding bit in the FLCTL_IFG

BitField.name: AVPST
BitField.description: If set to 1, enables the Controller to generate an interrupt based on the corresponding bit in the FLCTL_IFG

BitField.name: PRG
BitField.description: If set to 1, enables the Controller to generate an interrupt based on the corresponding bit in the FLCTL_IFG

BitField.name: PRGB
BitField.description: If set to 1, enables the Controller to generate an interrupt based on the corresponding bit in the FLCTL_IFG

BitField.name: ERASE
BitField.description: If set to 1, enables the Controller to generate an interrupt based on the corresponding bit in the FLCTL_IFG

BitField.name: BMRK
BitField.description: If set to 1, enables the Controller to generate an interrupt based on the corresponding bit in the FLCTL_IFG

BitField.name: PRG_ERR
BitField.description: If set to 1, enables the Controller to generate an interrupt based on the corresponding bit in the FLCTL_IFG

BitField.name: RDBRST

BitField.name: SETUP_LONG
BitField.description: Length of the Setup time into read mode when the device is recovering from one of the following conditions: Moving from Power-down or Standby back to Active and device is not trimmed. Moving from standby to active state in low-frequency active mode. Recovering from the LDO Boost operation after a Mass Erase.

Enum.name: ADC14ON_1
Enum.description: ADC14 on. ADC core is ready to power up when a valid conversion is triggered.

Enum.name: ADC14MSC_0
Enum.description: The sampling timer requires a rising edge of the SHI signal to trigger each sample-and-convert

Enum.name: ADC14MSC_1
Enum.description: The first rising edge of the SHI signal triggers the sampling timer, but further sample-and-conversions are performed automatically as soon as the prior conversion is completed

Enum.name: ADC14BUSY_1
Enum.description: A sequence, sample, or conversion is active

Enum.name: ADC14ISSH_0
Enum.description: The sample-input signal is not inverted

Enum.name: ADC14SHP_0
Enum.description: SAMPCON signal is sourced from the sample-input signal

Enum.name: ADC14SHP_1
Enum.description: SAMPCON signal is sourced from the sampling timer

Enum.name: ADC14SHS_1
Enum.description: See device-specific data sheet for source

Enum.name: ADC14SHS_2
Enum.description: See device-specific data sheet for source

Enum.name: ADC14SHS_3
Enum.description: See device-specific data sheet for source

Enum.name: ADC14SHS_4
Enum.description: See device-specific data sheet for source

Enum.name: ADC14SHS_5
Enum.description: See device-specific data sheet for source

Enum.name: ADC14SHS_6
Enum.description: See device-specific data sheet for source

Enum.name: ADC14SHS_7
Enum.description: See device-specific data sheet for source

Enum.name: ADC14PWRMD_0
Enum.description: Regular power mode for use with any resolution setting. Sample rate can be up to 1 Msps.

Enum.name: ADC14PWRMD_2
Enum.description: Low-power mode for 12-bit, 10-bit, and 8-bit resolution settings. Sample rate must not exceed 200 ksps.

Enum.name: ADC14REFBURST_1
Enum.description: ADC reference buffer on only during sample-and-conversion

Enum.name: ADC14DF_0
Enum.description: Binary unsigned. Theoretically, for ADC14DIF = 0 and 14-bit mode, the analog input voltage - V(REF) results in 0000h, and the analog input voltage + V(REF) results in 3FFFh

Enum.name: ADC14DF_1
Enum.description: Signed binary (2s complement), left aligned. Theoretically, for ADC14DIF = 0 and 14-bit mode, the analog input voltage - V(REF) results in 8000h, and the analog input voltage + V(REF) results in 7FFCh

BitField.name: ADC14BATMAP
BitField.description: Controls 1/2 AVCC ADC input channel selection

Enum.name: ADC14BATMAP_0
Enum.description: ADC internal 1/2 x AVCC channel is not selected for ADC

Enum.name: ADC14BATMAP_1
Enum.description: ADC internal 1/2 x AVCC channel is selected for ADC input channel MAX

BitField.name: ADC14TCMAP
BitField.description: Controls temperature sensor ADC input channel selection

Enum.name: ADC14TCMAP_0
Enum.description: ADC internal temperature sensor channel is not selected for ADC

Enum.name: ADC14TCMAP_1
Enum.description: ADC internal temperature sensor channel is selected for ADC input channel MAX-1

BitField.name: ADC14CH0MAP
BitField.description: Controls internal channel 0 selection to ADC input channel MAX-2

Enum.name: ADC14CH0MAP_0
Enum.description: ADC input channel internal 0 is not selected

Enum.name: ADC14CH0MAP_1
Enum.description: ADC input channel internal 0 is selected for ADC input channel MAX-2

BitField.name: ADC14CH1MAP
BitField.description: Controls internal channel 1 selection to ADC input channel MAX-3

Enum.name: ADC14CH1MAP_0
Enum.description: ADC input channel internal 1 is not selected

Enum.name: ADC14CH1MAP_1
Enum.description: ADC input channel internal 1 is selected for ADC input channel MAX-3

BitField.name: ADC14CH2MAP
BitField.description: Controls internal channel 2 selection to ADC input channel MAX-4

Enum.name: ADC14CH2MAP_0
Enum.description: ADC input channel internal 2 is not selected

Enum.name: ADC14CH2MAP_1
Enum.description: ADC input channel internal 2 is selected for ADC input channel MAX-4

BitField.name: ADC14CH3MAP
BitField.description: Controls internal channel 3 selection to ADC input channel MAX-5

Enum.name: ADC14CH3MAP_0
Enum.description: ADC input channel internal 3 is not selected

Enum.name: ADC14CH3MAP_1
Enum.description: ADC input channel internal 3 is selected for ADC input channel MAX-5

BitField.name: ADC14INIE
BitField.description: Interrupt enable for ADC14MEMx within comparator window

BitField.name: ADC14LOIE
BitField.description: Interrupt enable for ADC14MEMx below comparator window

BitField.name: ADC14HIIE
BitField.description: Interrupt enable for ADC14MEMx above comparator window

BitField.name: ADC14RDYIE
BitField.description: ADC14 local buffered reference ready interrupt enable

BitField.name: ADC14INIFG
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for ADC14MEMx within comparator window

BitField.name: ADC14LOIFG
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for ADC14MEMx below comparator window

BitField.name: ADC14HIIFG
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for ADC14MEMx above comparator window

BitField.name: ADC14TOVIFG
BitField.description: ADC14 conversion time overflow interrupt flag

BitField.name: ADC14RDYIFG

BitField.name: STIMENA
BitField.description: Bit mask to enable tracing on ITM stimulus ports. One bit per stimulus port.

BitField.name: PRIVMASK
BitField.description: Bit mask to enable tracing on ITM stimulus ports: bit [0] = stimulus ports [7:0], bit [1] = stimulus ports [15:8], bit [2] = stimulus ports [23:16], bit [3] = stimulus ports [31:24].

BitField.name: ITMENA
BitField.description: Enable ITM. This is the master enable, and must be set before ITM Stimulus and Trace Enable registers can be written.

BitField.name: TSENA
BitField.description: Enables differential timestamps. Differential timestamps are emitted when a packet is written to the FIFO with a non-zero timestamp counter, and when the timestamp counter overflows. Timestamps are emitted during idle times after a fixed number of two million cycles. This provides a time reference for packets and inter-packet gaps. If SWOENA (bit [4]) is set, timestamps are triggered by activity on the internal trace bus only. In this case there is no regular timestamp output when the ITM is idle.

BitField.name: SWOENA
BitField.description: Enables asynchronous clocking of the timestamp counter.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: Set when ITM events present and being drained.

BitField.name: ATVALIDM
BitField.description: When the integration mode is set: 0 = ATVALIDM clear. 1 = ATVALIDM set.

Enum.name: en_0b1
Enum.description: ATVALIDM driven from Integration Write Register

BitField.name: LOCK_ACCESS
BitField.description: A privileged write of 0xC5ACCE55 enables more write access to Control Register 0xE00::0xFFC. An invalid write removes write access.

BitField.name: PRESENT
BitField.description: Indicates that a lock mechanism exists for this component.

BitField.name: ACCESS
BitField.description: Write access to component is blocked. All writes are ignored, reads are permitted.

BitField.name: CYCCNTENA
BitField.description: Enable the CYCCNT counter. If not enabled, the counter does not count and no event is generated for PS sampling or CYCCNTENA. In normal use, the debugger must initialize the CYCCNT counter to 0.

BitField.name: POSTPRESET
BitField.description: Reload value for POSTCNT, bits [8:5], post-scalar counter. If this value is 0, events are triggered on each tap change (a power of 2). If this field has a non-0 value, this forms a count-down value, to be reloaded into POSTCNT each time it reaches 0. For example, a value 1 in this register means an event is formed every other tap change.

BitField.name: POSTCNT
BitField.description: Post-scalar counter for CYCTAP. When the selected tapped bit changes from 0 to 1 or 1 to 0, the post scalar counter is down-counted when not 0. If 0, it triggers an event for PCSAMPLENA or CYCEVTENA use. It also reloads with the value from POSTPRESET (bits [4:1]).

BitField.name: CYCTAP
BitField.description: Selects a tap on the DWT_CYCCNT register. These are spaced at bits [6] and [10]. When the selected bit in the CYCCNT register changes from 0 to 1 or 1 to 0, it emits into the POSTCNT, bits [8:5], post-scalar counter. That counter then counts down. On a bit change when post-scalar is 0, it triggers an event for PC sampling or CYCEVTCNT.

BitField.name: SYNCTAP
BitField.description: Feeds a synchronization pulse to the ITM SYNCENA control. The value selected here picks the rate (approximately 1/second or less) by selecting a tap on the DWT_CYCCNT register. To use synchronization (heartbeat and hot-connect synchronization), CYCCNTENA must be set to 1, SYNCTAP must be set to one of its values, and SYNCENA must be set to 1.

BitField.name: PCSAMPLEENA
BitField.description: Enables PC Sampling event. A PC sample event is emitted when the POSTCNT counter triggers it. See CYCTAP, bit [9], and POSTPRESET, bits [4:1], for details. Enabling this bit overrides CYCEVTENA (bit [20]). Reset clears the PCSAMPLENA bit.

BitField.name: EXCTRCENA
BitField.description: Enables Interrupt event tracing. Reset clears the EXCEVTENA bit.

BitField.name: CPIEVTENA
BitField.description: Enables CPI count event. Emits an event when DWT_CPICNT overflows (every 256 cycles of multi-cycle instructions). Reset clears the CPIEVTENA bit.

BitField.name: EXCEVTENA
BitField.description: Enables Interrupt overhead event. Emits an event when DWT_EXCCNT overflows (every 256 cycles of interrupt overhead). Reset clears the EXCEVTENA bit.

BitField.name: SLEEPEVTENA
BitField.description: Enables Sleep count event. Emits an event when DWT_SLEEPCNT overflows (every 256 cycles that the processor is sleeping). Reset clears the SLEEPEVTENA bit.

BitField.name: LSUEVTENA
BitField.description: Enables LSU count event. Emits an event when DWT_LSUCNT overflows (every 256 cycles of LSU operation). LSU counts include all LSU costs after the initial cycle for the instruction. Reset clears the LSUEVTENA bit.

BitField.name: FOLDEVTENA
BitField.description: Enables Folded instruction count event. Emits an event when DWT_FOLDCNT overflows (every 256 cycles of folded instructions). A folded instruction is one that does not incur even one cycle to execute. For example, an IT instruction is folded away and so does not use up one cycle. Reset clears the FOLDEVTENA bit.

BitField.name: CYCEVTENA
BitField.description: Enables Cycle count event. Emits an event when the POSTCNT counter triggers it. See CYCTAP (bit [9]) and POSTPRESET, bits [4:1], for details. This event is only emitted if PCSAMPLENA, bit [12], is disabled. PCSAMPLENA overrides the setting of this bit. Reset clears the CYCEVTENA bit.

BitField.name: NOPRFCNT
BitField.description: When set, DWT_FOLDCNT, DWT_LSUCNT, DWT_SLEEPCNT, DWT_EXCCNT, and DWT_CPICNT are not supported.

BitField.name: NOCYCCNT
BitField.description: When set, DWT_CYCCNT is not supported.

Register.name: DWT_CYCCNT
Register.description: DWT Current PC Sampler Cycle Count Register

BitField.name: CYCCNT
BitField.description: Current PC Sampler Cycle Counter count value. When enabled, this counter counts the number of core cycles, except when the core is halted. CYCCNT is a free running counter, counting upwards. It wraps around to 0 on overflow. The debugger must initialize this to 0 when first enabling.

BitField.name: CPICNT
BitField.description: Current CPI counter value. Increments on the additional cycles (the first cycle is not counted) required to execute all instructions except those recorded by DWT_LSUCNT. This counter also increments on all instruction fetch stalls. If CPIEVTENA is set, an event is emitted when the counter overflows. Clears to 0 on enabling.

BitField.name: EXCCNT
BitField.description: Current interrupt overhead counter value. Counts the total cycles spent in interrupt processing (for example entry stacking, return unstacking, pre-emption). An event is emitted on counter overflow (every 256 cycles). This counter initializes to 0 when enabled. Clears to 0 on enabling.

BitField.name: SLEEPCNT
BitField.description: Sleep counter. Counts the number of cycles during which the processor is sleeping. An event is emitted on counter overflow (every 256 cycles). This counter initializes to 0 when enabled. Note that SLEEPCNT is clocked using FCLK. It is possible that the frequency of FCLK might be reduced while the processor is sleeping to minimize power consumption. This means that sleep duration must be calculated with the frequency of FCLK during sleep.

BitField.name: LSUCNT
BitField.description: LSU counter. This counts the total number of cycles that the processor is processing an LSU operation. The initial execution cost of the instruction is not counted. For example, an LDR that takes two cycles to complete increments this counter one cycle. Equivalently, an LDR that stalls for two cycles (and so takes four cycles), increments this counter three times. An event is emitted on counter overflow (every 256 cycles). Clears to 0 on enabling.

BitField.name: FOLDCNT
BitField.description: This counts the total number folded instructions. This counter initializes to 0 when enabled.

BitField.name: EIASAMPLE
BitField.description: Execution instruction address sample, or 0xFFFFFFFF if the core is halted.

BitField.name: COMP
BitField.description: Data value to compare against PC and the data address as given by DWT_FUNCTION0. DWT_COMP0 can also compare against the value of the PC Sampler Counter (DWT_CYCCNT).

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask on data address when matching against COMP. This is the size of the ignore mask. hat is, DWT matching is performed as:(ADDR ANDed with (~0 left bit-shifted by MASK)) == COMP. However, the actual comparison is slightly more complex to enable matching an address wherever it appears on a bus. So, if COMP is 3, this matches a word access of 0, because 3 would be within the word.

BitField.name: FUNCTION
BitField.description: Function settings. Note 1: If the ETM is not fitted, then ETM trigger is not possible. Note 2: Data value is only sampled for accesses that do not fault (MPU or bus fault). The PC is sampled irrespective of any faults. The PC is only sampled for the first address of a burst. Note 3: PC match is not recommended for watchpoints because it stops after the instruction. It mainly guards and triggers the ETM.

Enum.name: en_0b0001
Enum.description: EMITRANGE = 0, sample and emit PC through ITM. EMITRANGE = 1, emit address offset through ITM

Enum.name: en_0b0010
Enum.description: EMITRANGE = 0, emit data through ITM on read and write. EMITRANGE = 1, emit data and address offset through ITM on read or write.

Enum.name: en_0b0011
Enum.description: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC and data value through ITM on read or write. EMITRANGE = 1, emit address offset and data value through ITM on read or write.

Enum.name: en_0b1011
Enum.description: ETM trigger on read or write

Enum.name: en_0b1100
Enum.description: EMITRANGE = 0, sample data for read transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr [15:0] for read transfers

Enum.name: en_0b1101
Enum.description: EMITRANGE = 0, sample data for write transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr [15:0] for write transfers

Enum.name: en_0b1110
Enum.description: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC + data for read transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr [15:0] + data for read transfers

Enum.name: en_0b1111
Enum.description: EMITRANGE = 0, sample PC + data for write transfers. EMITRANGE = 1, sample Daddr [15:0] + data for write transfers

BitField.name: EMITRANGE
BitField.description: Emit range field. Reserved to permit emitting offset when range match occurs. Reset clears the EMITRANGE bit. PC sampling is not supported when EMITRANGE is enabled. EMITRANGE only applies for: FUNCTION = b0001, b0010, b0011, b1100, b1101, b1110, and b1111.

BitField.name: DATAVMATCH
BitField.description: This bit is only available in comparator 1. When DATAVMATCH is set, this comparator performs data value compares. The comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1provide the address for the data comparison. If DATAVMATCH is set in DWT_FUNCTION1, the FUNCTION setting for the comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1 are overridden and those comparators only provide the address match for the data comparison.

BitField.name: DATAVSIZE
BitField.description: Defines the size of the data in the COMP register that is to be matched:

BitField.name: DATAVADDR0
BitField.description: Identity of a linked address comparator for data value matching when DATAVMATCH == 1.

BitField.name: DATAVADDR1
BitField.description: Identity of a second linked address comparator for data value matching when DATAVMATCH == 1 and LNK1ENA == 1.

BitField.name: MATCHED
BitField.description: This bit is set when the comparator matches, and indicates that the operation defined by FUNCTION has occurred since this bit was last read. This bit is cleared on read.

BitField.name: COMP
BitField.description: Data value to compare against PC and the data address as given by DWT_FUNCTION1.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask on data address when matching against COMP. This is the size of the ignore mask. hat is, DWT matching is performed as:(ADDR ANDed with (~0 left bit-shifted by MASK)) == COMP. However, the actual comparison is slightly more complex to enable matching an address wherever it appears on a bus. So, if COMP is 3, this matches a word access of 0, because 3 would be within the word.

BitField.name: FUNCTION
BitField.description: Function settings. Note 1: If the ETM is not fitted, then ETM trigger is not possible. Note 2: Data value is only sampled for accesses that do not fault (MPU or bus fault). The PC is sampled irrespective of any faults. The PC is only sampled for the first address of a burst. Note 3: FUNCTION is overridden for comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1 in DWT_FUNCTION1if DATAVMATCH is also set in DWT_FUNCTION1. The comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1 can then only perform address comparator matches for comparator 1 data matches. Note 4: If the data matching functionality is not included during implementation it is not possible to set DATAVADDR0, DATAVADDR1, or DATAVMATCH in DWT_FUNCTION1. This means that the data matching functionality is not available in the implementation. Test the availability of data matching by writing and reading the DATAVMATCH bit in DWT_FUNCTION1. If it is not settable then data matching is unavailable. Note 5: PC match is not recommended for watchpoints because it stops after the instruction. It mainly guards and triggers the ETM.

The comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1provide the address for the data comparison. If DATAVMATCH is set in DWT_FUNCTION1, the FUNCTION setting for the comparators given by DATAVADDR0 and DATAVADDR1 are overridden and those comparators only provide the address match for the data comparison.

BitField.name: DATAVADDR0

BitField.name: MATCHED
BitField.description: This bit is set when the comparator matches, and indicates that the operation defined by FUNCTION has occurred since this bit was last read. This bit is cleared on read.

BitField.name: KEY
BitField.description: Key field. To write to the Flash Patch Control Register, you must write a 1 to this write-only bit.

BitField.name: NUM_CODE2
BitField.description: Number of full banks of code comparators, sixteen comparators per bank. Where less than sixteen code comparators are provided, the bank count is zero, and the number present indicated by NUM_CODE. This read only field contains 3'b000 to indicate 0 banks for Cortex-M4 processor.

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Compare and remap enable for Flash Patch Comparator Register 0. The ENABLE bit of FP_CTRL must also be set to enable comparisons. Reset clears the ENABLE bit.

Enum.name: en_0b0
Enum.description: Flash Patch Comparator Register 0 compare and remap disabled

Enum.name: en_0b1
Enum.description: Flash Patch Comparator Register 0 compare and remap enabled

BitField.name: REPLACE
BitField.description: This selects what happens when the COMP address is matched. Settings other than b00 are only valid for instruction comparators. Literal comparators ignore non-b00 settings. Address remapping only takes place for the b00 setting.

Enum.name: en_0b00
Enum.description: remap to remap address. See FP_REMAP

Enum.name: en_0b01
Enum.description: set BKPT on lower halfword, upper is unaffected

Enum.name: en_0b10
Enum.description: set BKPT on upper halfword, lower is unaffected

Enum.name: en_0b11
Enum.description: set BKPT on both lower and upper halfwords.

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Compare and remap enable for Flash Patch Comparator Register 1. The ENABLE bit of FP_CTRL must also be set to enable comparisons. Reset clears the ENABLE bit.

Enum.name: en_0b0
Enum.description: Flash Patch Comparator Register 1 compare and remap disabled

Enum.name: en_0b1
Enum.description: Flash Patch Comparator Register 1 compare and remap enabled

RegisterGroup.name: SystemControlSpace
RegisterGroup.description: System Control Space for ARM core: SCnSCB, SCB, SysTick, NVIC, CoreDebug, MPU, FPU

BitField.name: INTLINESNUM
BitField.description: Total number of interrupt lines in groups of 32.

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: Disables interruption of multi-cycle instructions. This increases the interrupt latency of the processor becuase LDM/STM completes before interrupt stacking occurs.

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: Disables write buffer us during default memorty map accesses. This causes all bus faults to be precise bus faults but decreases the performance of the processor because the stores to memory have to complete before the next instruction can be executed.

BitField.name: DISOOFP
BitField.description: Disables floating point instructions completing out of order with respect to integer instructions.

BitField.name: RSTKEY
BitField.description: Write key to unlock reset request bits

BitField.name: SVSMH
BitField.description: Indicates if POR was caused by an SVSMH trip condition int the PSS

BitField.name: BGREF
BitField.description: Indicates if POR was caused by a BGREF not okay condition in the PSS

BitField.name: VCCDET
BitField.description: Indicates if POR was caused by a VCCDET trip condition in the PSS

BitField.name: SVSL
BitField.description: Indicates if POR was caused by an SVSL trip condition in the PSS

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Write 1 clears all PSS Reset Flags in the RSTCTL_PSSRESET_STAT

BitField.name: LPM35
BitField.description: Indicates if POR was caused by PCM due to an exit from LPM3.5

BitField.name: LPM45
BitField.description: Indicates if POR was caused by PCM due to an exit from LPM4.5

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Write 1 clears all PCM Reset Flags in the RSTCTL_PCMRESET_STAT

BitField.name: RSTNMI
BitField.description: POR was caused by RSTn/NMI pin based reset event

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Write 1 clears the RSTn/NMI Pin Reset Flag in RSTCTL_PINRESET_STAT

BitField.name: REBOOT
BitField.description: Indicates if Reboot reset was caused by the SYSCTL module.

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Write 1 clears the Reboot Reset Flag in RSTCTL_REBOOTRESET_STAT

BitField.name: DCOR_SHT
BitField.description: Indicates if POR was caused by DCO short circuit fault in the external resistor mode

BitField.name: CLR
BitField.description: Write 1 clears the DCOR_SHT Flag in RSTCTL_CSRESET_STAT as well as DCOR_SHTIFG flag in CSIFG register of clock system

BitField.name: REBOOT
BitField.description: Write 1 initiates a Reboot of the device

BitField.name: WKEY
BitField.description: Key to enable writes to bit 0

BitField.name: CS_SRC
BitField.description: CS interrupt as a source of NMI

Enum.name: CS_SRC_0
Enum.description: Disables CS interrupt as a source of NMI

Enum.name: CS_SRC_1
Enum.description: Enables CS interrupt as a source of NMI

BitField.name: PSS_SRC
BitField.description: PSS interrupt as a source of NMI

Enum.name: PSS_SRC_0
Enum.description: Disables the PSS interrupt as a source of NMI

Enum.name: PSS_SRC_1
Enum.description: Enables the PSS interrupt as a source of NMI

BitField.name: PCM_SRC
BitField.description: PCM interrupt as a source of NMI

Enum.name: PCM_SRC_0
Enum.description: Disbles the PCM interrupt as a source of NMI

Enum.name: PCM_SRC_1
Enum.description: Enables the PCM interrupt as a source of NMI

BitField.name: PIN_SRC
BitField.description: RSTn/NMI pin configuration Note: When the device enters LPM3/LPM4 modes of operation, the functionality selected by this bit is retained. If selected as an NMI, activity on this pin in LPM3/LPM4 wakes the device and processes the interrupt, without causing a POR. If selected as a Reset, activity on this pin in LPM3/LPM4 causes a device-level POR When the device enters LPM3.5/LPM4.5 modes of operation, this bit is always cleared to 0. In other words, the RSTn/NMI pin always assumes a reset functionality in LPM3.5/LPM4.5 modes.

Enum.name: PIN_SRC_0
Enum.description: Configures the RSTn_NMI pin as a source of POR Class Reset

Enum.name: PIN_SRC_1
Enum.description: Configures the RSTn_NMI pin as a source of NMI

BitField.name: CS_FLG
BitField.description: CS interrupt was the source of NMI

Enum.name: CS_FLG_0
Enum.description: indicates CS interrupt was not the source of NMI

Enum.name: CS_FLG_1
Enum.description: indicates CS interrupt was the source of NMI

BitField.name: PSS_FLG
BitField.description: PSS interrupt was the source of NMI

Enum.name: PSS_FLG_0
Enum.description: indicates the PSS interrupt was not the source of NMI

Enum.name: PSS_FLG_1
Enum.description: indicates the PSS interrupt was the source of NMI

BitField.name: PCM_FLG
BitField.description: PCM interrupt was the source of NMI

Enum.name: PCM_FLG_0
Enum.description: indicates the PCM interrupt was not the source of NMI

Enum.name: PCM_FLG_1
Enum.description: indicates the PCM interrupt was the source of NMI

BitField.name: PIN_FLG
BitField.description: RSTn/NMI pin was the source of NMI

Enum.name: PIN_FLG_0
Enum.description: Indicates the RSTn_NMI pin was not the source of NMI

Enum.name: PIN_FLG_1
Enum.description: Indicates the RSTn_NMI pin was the source of NMI

Enum.name: TIMEOUT_0
Enum.description: WDT timeout event generates Soft reset

Enum.name: TIMEOUT_1
Enum.description: WDT timeout event generates Hard reset

Enum.name: VIOLATION_0
Enum.description: WDT password violation event generates Soft reset

Enum.name: VIOLATION_1
Enum.description: WDT password violation event generates Hard reset

BitField.name: SIZE
BitField.description: Indicates the size of SRAM on the device

Enum.name: SRAM_RDY_0
Enum.description: SRAM is not ready for accesses. Banks are undergoing an enable or disable sequence, and reads or writes to SRAM are stalled until the banks are ready

Enum.name: SRAM_RDY_1
Enum.description: SRAM is ready for accesses. All SRAM banks are enabled/disabled according to values of bits 7:0 of this register

Enum.name: BNK1_RET_0
Enum.description: Bank1 of the SRAM is not retained in LPM3 or LPM4

Enum.name: BNK1_RET_1
Enum.description: Bank1 of the SRAM is retained in LPM3 and LPM4

Enum.name: BNK2_RET_0
Enum.description: Bank2 of the SRAM is not retained in LPM3 or LPM4

Enum.name: BNK2_RET_1
Enum.description: Bank2 of the SRAM is retained in LPM3 and LPM4

Enum.name: BNK3_RET_0
Enum.description: Bank3 of the SRAM is not retained in LPM3 or LPM4

Enum.name: BNK3_RET_1
Enum.description: Bank3 of the SRAM is retained in LPM3 and LPM4

Enum.name: BNK4_RET_0
Enum.description: Bank4 of the SRAM is not retained in LPM3 or LPM4

Enum.name: BNK4_RET_1
Enum.description: Bank4 of the SRAM is retained in LPM3 and LPM4

Enum.name: BNK5_RET_0
Enum.description: Bank5 of the SRAM is not retained in LPM3 or LPM4

Enum.name: BNK5_RET_1
Enum.description: Bank5 of the SRAM is retained in LPM3 and LPM4

Enum.name: BNK6_RET_0
Enum.description: Bank6 of the SRAM is not retained in LPM3 or LPM4

Enum.name: BNK6_RET_1
Enum.description: Bank6 of the SRAM is retained in LPM3 and LPM4

Enum.name: BNK7_RET_0
Enum.description: Bank7 of the SRAM is not retained in LPM3 or LPM4

Enum.name: BNK7_RET_1
Enum.description: Bank7 of the SRAM is retained in LPM3 and LPM4

Enum.name: SRAM_RDY_0
Enum.description: SRAM banks are being set up for retention. Entry into LPM3, LPM4 should not be attempted until this bit is set to 1

Enum.name: SRAM_RDY_1
Enum.description: SRAM is ready for accesses. All SRAM banks are enabled/disabled for retention according to values of bits 7:0 of this register

Register.name: SYS_DIO_GLTFLT_CTL
Register.description: Digital I/O Glitch Filter Control Register

Enum.name: GLTCH_EN_0
Enum.description: Disables glitch filter on the digital I/Os

Enum.name: GLTCH_EN_1
Enum.description: Enables glitch filter on the digital I/Os

Register.name: SYS_SECDATA_UNLOCK
Register.description: IP Protected Secure Zone Data Access Unlock Register

BitField.name: REGVAL
BitField.description: Value set by debugger, read and clear by the CPU

BitField.name: REGVAL
BitField.description: Value set by debugger, read and clear by the CPU

BitField.name: REGVAL
BitField.description: Value set by CPU, read/clear by the debugger

BitField.name: SOFT
BitField.description: Indicates if SOFT Reset is active

BitField.name: HARD
BitField.description: Indicates if HARD Reset is active

BitField.name: REBOOT
BitField.description: Indicates if Reboot Reset is active

BitField.name: JTAG_SWD_LOCK_ACT
BitField.description: Indicates if JTAG and SWD Lock is active

BitField.name: IP_PROT_ACT
BitField.description: Indicates if IP protection is active

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: DISOOFP
BitField.description: Disables floating pointinstructions completing outof order with respect to integer instructions

BitField.name: DISFPCA
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables IT folding

BitField.name: DISFOLD
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: ADDRESSS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame

BitField.name: DZC
BitField.description: Division by Zero cumulative exception bit

BitField.name: IREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU instruction regions

BitField.name: DREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU data regions

BitField.name: SEPARATE
BitField.description: Support for unified or separate instruction and date memory maps

BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA
BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to the default memory map

BitField.name: HFNMIENA
BitField.description: Enable the operation of MPU during hard fault, NMI, and FAULTMASK handlers

BitField.name: REGION
BitField.description: Indicates the MPU region referenced by the MPU_RBAR and MPU_RASR registers

Register.name: MPU_RASR
Register.description: MPU Region Attribute and Size Register
